Oh, and top of that it’s about rebelling against capitalism via oyster farming - and it’s made by a real-life oyster farmer. Let’s get into this package of joys.
Read more
articles.title: Celeste’s slick movement meets Zelda’s hookshot in Oyster Wars, “intense” platformer by an actual oyster farmer about revenge against Big Oyster

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Historical strategy sim Manor Lords - which budding feudal despot Nic Reuben has deemed "a sturdy and immersive builder that feels incomplete yet alive with promise" - is now available on Steam, the Epic Games Store, Microsoft Store and GOG. It was Steam's most wishlisted game before launch, and it's so popular right now that Steam's servers are struggling to keep up: there's an official developer post on the game's Steam forum warning that "the store is overwhelmed from all the people buying, it may take a couple tries for a bit while things calm down".
 Read more
articles.title: Manor Lords publisher reassures players struggling to buy at launch that "we'll run those 25% discounts often"

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Hurtling along on top of a train full of goons in Phantom Fury you will see another rushing train pulling up at matching speed, inviting you to hop from one to the other. A helicopter will soon join the fray. Many things will soon explode, and you will take a short break from the minigunning to calmly physics some boxes into a set of steps with a crane. This FPS is not so much writing a love letter to a bygone era of noughties shooters, as it is standing underneath the window of its respected elders earnestly serenading them with a busted old keytar from the attic. There are bum notes and the singing voice is not exactly boy-band beautiful, but the love is unmistakably there. And, hey, singing is hard.
Read more
articles.title: Phantom Fury review: a retro shooter obsessed with inconsequential do-hickeys

articles.author: Corinna Burton
articles.description:
Although Corsair aren't included in our current best gaming SSDs guide, their compact form factor SSDs, including the MP600 Mini, are probably some of the best M.2 2230 SSDs on the market to pair with your Steam Deck gaming console.
Read more
articles.title: Upgrade your Steam Deck storage with Corsair's MP600 Mini 1TB SSD for just £70

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
While playing Manor Lords for review, I kept making mental notes to spend time watching the individual routes its villagers and beasts take each day. It’s one of those interestingly granular games that actually becomes more so by remaining a bit mysterious in ways I’m sure will annoy some, so I reasoned some people-watching would be illuminating. And by people, I mean oxen.
 
Read more
articles.title: I followed this ox around in Manor Lords for a day to see what wisdom it could teach me

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Tucked away in the corner of this year's Day Of The Devs at GDC I discovered a lavish, strangely unattended action-RPG, in which austerely beautiful young women in elaborate skirts kick the bejazus out of each other on fields of whirling flowers. That game was Aikode, the work of Spanish solo developer Ace. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Even if we never get Stellar Blade on PC, action-RPG Aikode looks comparably swish

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
I don’t want to strike sweaty terror into anyone’s gentle hearts here, but I’m beginning to suspect lately that the friendly clown emojis I keep seeing as reactions to Steam user reviews aren’t actually a colorful kudos to the writer for being a chucklesome and whimsical individual. I’m starting to fear, actually, that this one icon of a behatted japester may have been widely adopted as an oddly hostile way to single out dissenting opinions, rapidly accelerating the Steam reviews’ grisly metamorphosis into something that more resembles a clout-farming social app than anything with pretensions towards facilitating helpfulness or self expression.
 
Read more
articles.title: Unpacking the cursed digital object that is Steam’s clown reaction emoji

articles.author: Kiera Mills
articles.description:
Lethal Company is a fun game but I know what you're thinking: it lacks feline energy. Whilst the simplistic game loop of collecting scrap on monster-infested moons and selling it to an equally monstrous company is enjoyable at first, it can get old pretty fast. As both Alice and James have attested with their experiences of this month's RPS Game Club pick, Lethal Company is a game that lacks a certain direction the more you play. I soon found myself settling into an existential crisis, reminiscent of my tumultuous stint in retail. A recurring thought back then was why bother stacking shelves, only to have someone buy the products and make me re-stack them again?
In the vain hopes of gaining a higher purpose in Lethal Company, I stumbled across the 'Needy Cats' mod. Essentially this mod adds a variety of cats to your game that will wander around the facilities and yelp for attention.
Perhaps I'm just a glutton for heartbreak, but I decided that the game needed a galactic sanctuary full of adorable balls of floof. I hearkened back to my time playing Stray, the adorable cat adventure set in a post-apocalypse where humanity was all but wiped out. Could this be the prequel to Lethal Company? What if all Apocalypse games share the same universe, all orchestrated by The Company secretly pulling the strings of fate? Or maybe I just wanted to look at cute cats instead of terrifying mannequin monsters. Either way, the cats needed help. What follows is a diary log of my adventures which soon lead to increasing madness and ultimately, disaster.
Read more
articles.title: I tried to recreate Stray in Lethal Company, with disastrous results

articles.author: Kiera Mills
articles.description:
It's finally time for this month's RPS Game Club live blog. This April, we've been tackling the comedy-horror Lethal Company. Whilst some of us have enjoyed the nonsensical hijinks Lethal Company can offer, others have been less enthused with the progression system and prefer the shiny newbie experience. 
We've had some good chat on the matter. Although, I've mostly been preoccupied by the various hardworking monsters in the game. Now, it's your turn to hit us with your questions (or your shovels). Let's chat about all things Lethal Company, today (April 26th) at 4pm BST.
Read more
articles.title: Join us with your most valuable scrap to talk about Lethal Company in today's RPS Game Club liveblog!

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Great was the consternation of singleplayer horror likers at the popularity of Lethal Company, a landmark creepfest and satire of corporate piecework that is best enjoyed in groups of four. When will developer Zeekerss give us a proper singleplayer campaign mode, the loners of the gaming community wondered, peering from their boltholes and eyries. A Lethal Sole Trader, as it were - or failing that, how about some bot support? Well, this particular monkeypaw finger has curled. It curled about four years ago, actually, when Zeekerss released singleplayer-only horror compilation It Steals. 


I've been playing It Steals (available on Itch and Steam for £4 or $5) as part of our latest Lethal Company-dedicated Game Club, and let me tell you, it makes Lethal Company look positively, er, Nonlethal. There are many points of comparison between games, but while Lethal Company is geared more obviously for laughs, with its whoopie cushions and ReactionTube-friendly co-op mechanics, It Creeps just wants to scare you shitless. It's also brilliant.

 
Read more
articles.title: If you want a single-player Lethal Company, don't miss the developer's previous It Steals

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
James made the observation that Lethal Company, a co-op game about being haunted space binmen, and this month's pick for the RPS Game Club, gets less fun the better you are at it. This is true! It's also janky, and the RNG on the weird, warren-like buildings prompted me to ask "Who designed this? What is this for? What kind of office is this??" out loud, as I faced yet another dead end full of pipes. And yet! There's something about it that endears me to it far more than other similar games like Phasmophobia. Games like this all largely rely on you making your own fun with the tools they provide, but I think we should give the Lethal Company devs props for their tools, because they are weird and make no sense, and allow for some fantastic slapstick.
Read more
articles.title: I respect Lethal Company's dedication to being a slapstick-fest that makes zero sense whatsoever

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Mayors in RPG games are rarely given the spotlight. They're mostly just there to give you an early quest involving goat banditry or windmill rats or some such other domestic drudgery. Or, in the case of Tristram’s mayor in Diablo, to fret behind the scenes about how to properly fit considerable cathedral repairs into this month’s budget. Well, no more must this valuable civil servant hide behind balance sheets, occasionally popping out to cut a big ribbon in celebration of a nearby mausoleum being turned into a Wetherspoons. Tristam is a 72 hour Ludum Dare project where you play as said town’s mayor. And this time: It’s ceremonial!
 
Read more
articles.title: Stay awhile and play this free Diablo-inspired indie as the mayor of Tristram

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Left-handed Counter-Strike 2 players, time to raise that left hand in what could be interpreted as a celebration. In the game's latest update, Valve have added the ability to swap from the default right-handed viewmodel to a left-handed one. There's also an update to the buy menu, making it easier to track your bank account and grab weapons your mates have dropped. Alongside further UI improvements for grenade line-ups, and a tweak to the Active Duty map pool.
 
Read more
articles.title: Counter-Strike 2 finally gets left-handed view models, seven months after launch

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Eco-conscious village builder The Wandering Village sees you raising a settlement on the back of a huge wandering creature called Onbu. For the most part, you live in a symbiotic relationship with this gentle giant, as your villagers keep the gargantuan trundlesaur healthy while being ferried about on its back. Awww. Well, the wholesome city-builder now lets you feed villagers to the creature and start a cult in the great devourer's name. Okay. Why not?
Read more
articles.title: You can now feed people to the big beast in The Wandering Village

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Escape From Tarkov, the extraction FPS from developer Battlestate, recently put up a new Unheard edition of the game for pre-order, and tarkov escapers aren't happy about it. The price for this bundle - which includes a new mode, a bigger stash, and assorted gubbins - comes in at $250, or around two actual hundred actual pounds, but the price alone isn’t necessarily what’s got a section of the player base so tarked-off that a few of them are even loudly considering a lawsuit. 

The actual issue is twofold: the edition is being called pay-to-win, and is also the only way to access said new PvE co-op mode, despite players previously shelling out notable nuggets for what was pitched as access to "all subsequent DLCs" as part of the now-delisted Edge of Darkness edition.
 
Read more
articles.title: New Escape From Tarkov PvE mode exclusive to pricey Unheard edition despite promises of free DLC

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Manor Lords is obviously this week's big survival-citybuilder game release, but I suspect Diluvian Winds is more my pace. It's a "relaxing management game" about building a town for anthropomorphic animals around the foot of a lighthouse, although exactly how relaxing will depend on your ability to prepare for tsunamis and other weather emergencies which can strike and destroy your buildings. It's out now.

 
Read more
articles.title: Manor Lords too realistic or grimy for you? Try cosy survival townbuilder Diluvian Winds, out today

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
We haven't written much about Korean MMO ArcheAge since reviewing it nine years ago, and there won't be many future opportunities to write about it, either. Its developers have announced that its European and North American servers will shut down on June 27th.

 
Read more
articles.title: After ten years, Korean MMO ArcheAge is closing its European and North American servers

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
People Can Fly, the developers of Bulletstorm and Outriders, have cancelled development of a co-op action RPG codenamed Project Dagger. The Polish company informed investors of the decision to cancel the game, which was initially to be published by Take-Two, earlier this month.

 
Read more
articles.title: Bulletstorm and Outriders studio have cancelled development on a co-op action RPG

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
BlizzCon, Blizzard's annual get-together for fans of their games, was halted by the pandemic in 2020 and only returned as a physical event last year. One year later, it is cancelled again, Blizzard have announced.

 
Read more
articles.title: BlizzCon won't happen in 2024

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
I never expected to feel genuine affection for Dr Robotnik, whose various level-ending wrecking balls and spiked doodads have killed me a million times over, but here I am sobbing like a banshee over the release of Dr Robotnik's Ring Racers, a free Mario Kart-alike created by Kart Krew, the fangamer team behind Sonic Robo Blast 2 Kart, using the Doom Legacy source port.
Read more
articles.title: Dr Robotnik's Ring Racers is a gorgeous free SNES-style arcade racer, built using Doom Legacy

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
This week saw the first (small) look at the new and upcoming Hobbit-themed cosy life sim Tales Of The Shire, plus the news that Embracer group is splitting into three, including a Middle-earth And Friends group. We thus use this as an excuse to spend some time talking about The Lord Of The Rings games we'd like to see, plus our favourite Rings games from days gone by (and also Gollum, and also we do impressions of Gollum).
Nate has been playing an impressive number of games, including one that did not allow him to invent the stick and therefore hampered his progress. We also talk about AI NPCs again, because one of them tried to get James drunk. Plus: some lovely recommendations to round off your weekly pod (one of them is a long life meat product).
Read more
articles.title: The Electronic Wireless Show podcast S3 Episode 16: the new hobbit life sim and our favourite The Lord Of The Rings games

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The announcement trailer for Lost Legions opens with a Roman Emperor bellowing “GIVE ME BACK MY LEGIONS” like a kid who’s just had his pudding taken away. I'd just had a big swig of coffee before watching, and was instantly swept off by visions of an apoplectic Roman bigwig rampaging through the forests of darkest Germania, gluing abducted legionnaires together into a sort of Octavian katamari... and then they revealed that it’s another open world survival game, with no less than two trailer beats dedicated to the act of hacking down a tree. 


I mean no disrespect to developers Tarock Interactive - they're not to blame for my addled imagination - but there are many open world survival games and as a weary Ed Thorn recently noted, the majority are heavily frontloaded with wilderness carpentry. I don’t think survival games should emphasise wood-chopping in their announcement footage. It's like doing a Call of Duty montage of people getting shot three seconds from spawn. Still, if there's no katamari mechanic, the idea of raising a small army of mostly AI-controlled Roman soldiers behind enemy lines has a certain charm. Without further ado, here’s the trailer.
 
Read more
articles.title: In new open world game Lost Legions you are a Roman "rebuilding the empire" behind enemy lines

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
I think the stronger your interest in white goods becomes, that's how you know you're transitioning from a youngster to a slightly oldster. The first thing I did recently when I stepped into my friend's house was compliment him on his new washing machine. "A Samsung! Nice dials on this, eh?", I said as I twisted the dial and it pleasantly bumped from mixed to delicate wash. What can I say? I appreciate the mundane and the useful.
And from the times I've played Lethal Company, I've come to think it's also a game about appreciating the mundane, too.
Read more
articles.title: Lethal Company is as much about protecting the mundane, as it is a horror game

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Pine: A Story Of Loss, which stars a bereaved woodworker and thus may be a play on the double meaning of ‘pine’, is a gorgeously animated interactive fiction game that sees you performing farming chores and wordlessly reminiscing upon cherished memories. It’s short - designed to be played in a couple of sittings - and while the fiction is the focus here, you’ll spend time gardening and whittling in bespoke minigames as you find out more about the woodworker’s relationship. The publisher describes it thusly:
 
Read more
articles.title: Gorgeous interactive fiction Pine: A Story Of Loss is a small sad game about a big sad man

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
As genre mash-ups go, I didn't see this coming. But maybe I should have, knowing how once things like battle royales pop off, they will always spawn curious mutations. Inferni: Hope And Fear is one of these curiosities, being an online co-op, deckbuilding, battle royale, with a 90s theme.
Read more
articles.title: Inferni: Hope And Fear is an online co-op deckbuilding battle royale, if you were after such a thing

articles.author: Kiera Mills
articles.description:
To keep the ball rolling with this month's Game Club pick, we're asking what you, the readers, think of Lethal Company?
By now, I can confidently say that the RPS team are scrap collecting experts and can easily meet the quota set by the enigmatic Company. Much to James' chagrin, who prefers the chaos of being objectively 'bad' at the game. So confident was I in our abilities after our co-op sesh, that I dove into a solo game. Cue immediate death by a vengeful face-hugging bug. I'm expecting my first round of xenomorph child maintenance fees any day now.
With our blog chat scheduled for Friday 26th April, 4 PM GMT, here are a few conversation prompts we've gathered ahead of time. Tell us your thoughts in the comments and shoot any questions our way too. We hope to see you there!
Read more
articles.title: RPS Game Club Asks: What do you think of Lethal Company?

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Fallout 4's "next generation" update goes live today. Timed to capitalise on the Fallout TV show's mad popularity, it'll encumber the 2015-released open world wasteland RPG with widescreen and ultra-widescreen support, Creation Kit fixes, and a "variety of quest updates" across Steam, Microsoft Store and GOG. There will be new items for the Creation Club, including the Makeshift Weapon Pack, which lets you blast people with a piggy bank like Elon Musk, and a new quest, Echoes Of The Past, in which you try to "stop The Enclave from spreading their dangerous ideology and gaining a foothold in the Commonwealth".
They're also bringing the game to the Epic Games Store and upgrading it to Steam Deck Verified status. Such days of bounty we do live through, but beware - it's possible the update will break existing Fallout 4 mods, which will be a problem for the very large numbers of you who've been downloading mods after watching the show. Indeed, the possibility of today's update messing with mods has already seen the creators of the promising Fallout: London delay release to assess the damage. If you're similarly concerned, you might want to disable auto-updates right now.
 Read more
articles.title: Fallout 4's "next gen" update is out today and might break your mods - here's how to stop it

articles.author: Kiera Mills
articles.description:
Most of my time in Lethal Company is full of tomfoolery, panicking, and ultimately letting the quota down. As I run back and forth from the ship, only able to carry four things at a time in my puny arms, I frequently see the various monster inhabitants of the game excelling at pretty much everything. The Forest Keeper has brawny strength and can travel across the map in a blink of an eye, the Eyeless Dogs can sniff out an intruder in next to no time and The Butler has dedicated his life to maintaining a mansion even after the owners have long since gone.
This had me thinking - surely the various monster inhabitants of Lethal Company would make for a much better worker than myself?
Sure, most of them are ravenous killing machines - but that fits with the core values of The Company. After all, most of your time spent in the game will be collecting scrap on distant moons to meet an arbitrary quota set by The Company. You'll then feed your pilfered belongings to the insatiable maw of a tentacled horror (otherwise known as the boss). You may be able to sympathise depending on your occupation.
So, if the monsters in Lethal Company were given the chance to work for said company, which of them would make it as an employee of the month and which would crash and burn harder than me getting thrown from the airlock five times in a row?
Join me as I peruse the CV's of my favourite monsters in Lethal Company (as far as I know only half of them have opposable thumbs) and advocate for which of them should be my replacement as The Company's new hire. After all, once this month's Games Club is finished I'm not sure they'll even let me back on the ship.
Read more
articles.title: I have determined which Lethal Company monster is the hardest worker and should be hired

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
The closest I have come to having any interest in sport is when I got really into reading about football hooligans, or like, Blood Bowl, but I do absolutely recognise the romance of it all. SUDDEN DEATH is a delicious free slice of playable art-pie that celebrates that romance. It is - says dev Cécile, who co-made the project with Nat Pussy and MOTHER GOOSE for collective Domino Club - “a game about love and sports. it's gay, it's very australian, and it's great.” You can tell it’s Australian quickly, because people call chips ‘chippies’, which makes me chuffed.
 
Read more
articles.title: SUDDEN DEATH is a free slice of interactive fiction about love, drugs, and Australian football

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Alien-infested submarine sim Barotrauma has received a chunky update, bringing two new-ish monsters into its lethal aquatic world. The shrimp-looking Mantis may be recognisable to veterans (it once appeared in pre-Steam builds). And the Viperling is a venomous variant of the existing Spineling (a thorny seaworm with hull-piercing porcupine-like spikes). But don't worry, the medical systems have also seen a "mini-rework", which means drugs like morphine are "less of a 'solution for everything'". Wait. What?


Submariners in the game can still use morphine, opium and fentanyl to ease the pain of a monster attack, broken bones, wrecked organs, or be-bulleted body. However, the developers feel these drugs have been over-used. So they've rebalanced the opiates as part of their Blood in the Water update. Now the drugs have "a much higher risk of causing addiction and overdoses, and morphine heals much more slowly, making it less viable for combat-heavy situations." Well. Guess I'll just die. 
 
Read more
articles.title: Aqua horror sim Barotrauma has an update that makes opiates "less of a solution for everything"

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
As an Assassin's Creed girlie, I enjoyed Assassin's Creed Mirage, a pared down (but still big game, which is really just proof of how bloated AAA games have gotten, but I'll stop because it's not time to take my personal bugbear for a walk) Ass Creed game that was closer to the simplicity of the older games in the stab 'em up stealth-action series. Yesterday creative director Stéphane Boudon and art director Jeal-Luc Sala took to Reddit for an AMA, and in response to a question about plans for Mirage DLC, Boudon said no - but that they have ideas for more stories for Basim.
Read more
articles.title: Assassin's Creed Mirage won't get story DLC, but the devs have "ideas on how we could extend the story of Basim"

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
My experience with actual flight simulators typically amounts to approaching the runway far, far too quickly at far, far too perpendicular an angle, so perhaps I’m better off just flying folded-up bits of A4. Happily, that’s exactly what Paper Sky, a "semi-open world paper plane adventure" from solo indie dev Brute Force, is offering.
Read more
articles.title: Paper Sky is a joyful flight sim for people who suck at flight sims, and there’s a demo out now

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
In a rare case of a wild Nintendo being spotted having somewhat of a point, actually, in regards to being protective over their IP, Facepunch announced yesterday that they’re removing all “Nintendo stuff” from Garry’s Mod’s Steam workshop, following takedown orders sent straight from ninty themselves.
 
Read more
articles.title: Garry’s mod is removing “Nintendo Stuff” after takedown notices, but users suspect foul play from fraudsters

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
I can feel some kind of sore throat bug coming on. It must be the baleful influence of Creative Assembly's latest free update for bellowing strategy bonanza Total War: Warhammer 3. Out 30th April, the update introduces Epidemius, Proctor of Pestilence - a new Nurgle Legendary Lord who gains rewards based on how many ickle diseases you’ve spread to other factions (already my favourite aspect of playing Nurgle in the game). Does Epidemius also get buffs if the player is infected by something? I hope so. It would be a consolation to know that my ailing trachea is contributing to the Nurgle cause.


That’s not the only new addition in TWW3 patch 5. They’re also bringing a Gold Wizard hero, who is sort of Magneto but blingier, and a cursed crown that will make everybody hate you. Let’s dig in.
 
Read more
articles.title: The next free Total War: Warhammer 3 update makes spreading Nurgle plagues even more rewarding

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
PlayerUnknown’s Battlegrounds - aka the game that inspired and then was overtaken by Fortnite’s Battle Royale mode - is seemingly borrowing a leaf from its cartoony cousin’s playbook by resurrecting its original map.
Read more
articles.title: PUBG, the game that Fortnite copied, copies Fortnite by bringing back the battle royale shooter’s original map

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
The developers behind Fable card game spin-off Fable Fortune and the digital adaptation of dungeon-crawling board game Gloomhaven have revealed a new upcoming co-op RPG… only to announce at the same time that the upcoming game’s development has been put on pause amid layoffs at the studio and difficulty finding funding.
Read more
articles.title: Former Fable devs reveal a new co-op RPG, then announce its development is on hold amid layoffs

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
As a somewhat deflating example of the money-churning might of GTA Online becoming the sole focus of Rockstar’s Grand Theft Auto 5 efforts over the last decade, the actor who played Trevor in the ridiculously well-selling crime epic has teased some details of planned story DLC that would have turned the controversial protagonist into a James Bond-style spy. The pack supposedly got as far as shooting with the actors, only to end up cancelled and folded into a GTA Online heist.
Read more
articles.title: GTA5 nearly had story DLC that made Trevor a 007-style spy - until it was cancelled and turned into a GTA Online heist

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Dark Souls, one of the most widely acclaimed video games of the last two decades - perhaps all time - and progenitor of one of modern video gaming’s most influential and oft-copied-rarely-bettered genres, the Soulslike, would’ve been a better game had it launched into early access. That’s the suggestion from the head of Ori and the Blind Forest developers Moon Studios in the wake of launching their own early access Soulslike, No Rest For The Wicked.
Read more
articles.title: Dark Souls would’ve been a better game in early access, says dev behind Dark Souls-like early access game No Rest For The Wicked

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Welcome back to Should You Bother With, the RPS hardware column that combs away the fluff surrounding PC gaming gear to reveal a smooth, hairless core of pure consumer advice. This time: Hall effect keyboards, a relatively fresh flavour of desktop peripheral that’s been gaining traction with manufacturers for the switch design’s supposed durability and reliability benefits. These represent perhaps the first major challenge to mechanical keyboard hegemony, but you may be wondering: who’s Hall? What’s their effect? And does it actually make for a better gaming keyboard? Time to found out.
Read more
articles.title: Should You Bother With... Hall effect keyboards?

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Svatopluk Vít)
articles.description: Používám operační systém Linux a došlo na obměnu domácího notebooku. Opustil jsem vody tradičních výrobců jako je Dell, HP nebo Lenovo a místo toho zkusil „zakázkový“ linuxový hardware a software z Německa. Jak to dopadlo?
articles.title: Tuxedo Computers: německý dodavatel počítačů to s Linuxem myslí vážně

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Popíšeme si dvojici potenciálně velmi užitečných a přitom méně známých kontejnerů: Counter a multimnožiny. Taktéž se zmíníme o multislovníku, s nímž se taktéž můžeme v praxi setkat.
articles.title: Kontejnery v Pythonu: zdaleka nejde jen o n-tice, seznamy, množiny a slovníky (2)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jiří Sluka)
articles.description: Dnes se ponoříme do světa digitální forenzní analýzy, prozkoumáme porty a ulovíme nejlepší videa z webu. Google přináší emoce do telefonních hovorů s Audio Emoji – protože někdy stačí potlesk, aby bylo řečeno vše!
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (1. 5. 2024): identifikace, vyšetřování a řešení incidentů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Seznámíme se s vybranými kontejnery (containers), které je možné použít při tvorbě aplikací v Pythonu. Kontejnerů přitom existuje velké množství a zdaleka se nejedná jen o n-tice, seznamy, množiny a slovníky.
articles.title: Kontejnery v Pythonu: zdaleka nejde jen o n-tice, seznamy, množiny a slovníky

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Novotný)
articles.description: Webová API hrají v evitaDB klíčovou roli – řada zásadních rozhodnutí byla učiněna právě s ohledem na jejich dopady na úrovni webových API. Předpokládáme, že právě webová API budou hlavní vstupní branou k uloženým datům.
articles.title: evitaDB: práce s daty přes webová API

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Monika Kutějová)
articles.description: Tento týden se podíváme na využití AI k lepším kybernetickým operacím, nově se šířící malware Brokewell v Androidu, zneužití chyb v nástrojích Windows a další ohrožení bezpečnosti ve WordPressu.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: s umělou inteligencí k lepším kyberútokům

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Microsoft uvolnil zdrojové kódy systémů MS-DOS 4.0 pod svobodnou licencí MIT. Jsou dostupné první ISO obrazy pro veřejné testování Ubuntu Lomiri. Retro distribuce Arix přináší prostředí KDE 1.1.2 na Debianu 13.
articles.title: MS-DOS 4.0 pod MIT licencí, nová příchuť Ubuntu s prostředím Lomiri

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Servo engine zvládá test Acid2, výrazně rychlejší start Zink ovladače, Sovereign Tech Fund investuje do GNOME, PHP či hledání chyb v systemd, výkon CPU AMD vs Intel v Ubuntu 22.04, 23.10 i 24.04.
articles.title: Výkon AMD Ryzen a Intel Core v novém Ubuntu, GTK přechází na Vulkan

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nové Ubuntu 24.04 LTS Noble Numbat je zde, nepřináší prakticky nic jiného než předvídatelnou evoluci a je to tak správně. Novinek je ale i přesto spousta, byť třeba fanoušky Kubuntu čeká malé zklamání.
articles.title: Ubuntu 24.04 LTS Noble Numbat: skvěle nudné vydání s mnohaletou podporou

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Tento článek je volným pokračování předchozího článku Sdílení objektů mezi vlákny jednoduše v C++20. Tentokrát se podíváme na jiné řešení, které má ambice se dostat do normy C++26.
articles.title: Sdílení objektů mezi vlákny v C++20 (II)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Včera uběhlo 60 let od uvedení první verze programovacího jazyka BASIC, tedy Beginners' All-purpose Symbolic Instruction Code. Původní verzi vytvořili už v roce 1963 John G. Kemeny a Thomas E. Kurtz na Dartmouth College. První jmenovaný později v roce 1979 vedl prezidentskou vyšetřovací komisi k havárii na jaderné elektrárně Three Mile Island, sám pak zemřel v 66 letech v roce 1992, druhý jmenovaný letos v únoru oslavil 96. narozeniny.
articles.title: BASIC oslavil 60 let

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Společnost Intel v posledních týdnech až měsících řeší závažný problém, kdy její procesory 13. a 14. řady předčasně umírají. Podle všeho jsou tyto primárně K-čkové (tedy „overclockerské“) modely provozovány za hranou toho, co křemík unese a podíly reklamovaných kusů jsou extrémně vysoké.
articles.title: CPU Intel umírají, dopad oprav na výkon je v jednotkách procent

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Pojďte s námi prozkoumat tajuplný svět hackingu a množství jeho jednotlivých zákoutí. Průvodcem na této cestě vám bude zkušený etický hacker s mnohaletou praxí, který se s vámi podělí o své zkušenosti. Připravili jsme pro vás šestidenní online kurz Hacking v praxi, který je z velké části placený úřadem práce.
articles.title: Šestidenní online kurz Hacking v praxi dotovaný úřadem práce

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Národní úřad pro letectví a vesmír (NASA) demonstroval schopnosti optické komunikace na velkou vzdálenost. Sonda Psyche míří ke stejnojmenné planetce a v současné době se nachází ve vzdálenosti 226 milionů kilometrů od Země. Odtud je schopná přenášet zpět data rychlostí 25 Mbps.
articles.title: NASA přenesla data rychlostí 25 Mbps ze vzdálenosti 226 milionů kilometrů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Výrobce linuxového hardwaru Tuxedo Computers dnes představil notebook Tuxedo Pulse 14 Gen4 s aktualizovaným procesorem AMD Ryzen 7. Čtvrtá generace v této modelové řadě představuje 4nm procesor AMD Ryzen 7 8845HS s 8 jádry a 16 vlákny, 24 MB cache (L2+L3), TDP 54 W, taktem až 5,1 GHz, který je doplněn o grafiku Radeon 780M s 12 jádry GPU a taktem až 2700 MHz.
articles.title: Tuxedo Pulse 14 Gen4 obsahuje AMD Ryzen 7 8845HS a Radeon 780M

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Ve Velké Británii začala platit nová verze zákona o bezpečnosti výrobků a telekomunikační infrastruktuře (PTSI) z roku 2022, která se vztahuje téměř na vše, co si spotřebitel může koupit a připojit k internetu. Podle novely této směrnice musí mít i to nejmenší zařízení s Wi-Fi buď náhodné heslo, nebo musí být heslo vygenerováno při inicializaci.
articles.title: Britský zákon zakazuje výchozí hesla na zařízeních připojených k síti

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Vývojáři uvolnili novou verzi distribuce T2 Linux 24.5, která se zaměřuje na plnou podporu co největšího množství architektur a několika různých standardních knihoven C. Vývojové prostředí T2 System umožňuje plně automatizované vytváření vlastních operačních systémů pomocí nejmodernějších aktuálních balíčků s integrovanou podporou křížové kompilace pro reprodukovatelná sestavení.
articles.title: Distribuce T2 vyšla ve verzi 24.5, podporuje 25 architektur včetně IA-64

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Lennart Poettering, hlavní vývojář systemd, představil utilitu run0 , což je náhrada známého příkazu sudo.  Opravuje mnoho problémů spojených s tímto široce používaným nástrojem pro získání dočasných zvýšených oprávnění. S příkazem sudo jsou různé problémy, které v podstatě spočívají v tom, že se jedná o rozsáhlou binárku s příznakem SUID. Skládá se z privilegovaného kódu, který mohou neprivilegovaní uživatelé spouštět ze svého vlastního kontextu.
articles.title: Utilita run0 je bezpečnější náhradou za sudo založenou na systemd

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Norbert Landsteiner vytvořil virtuální počítač DEC PDP-1 emulovaný v jazyce HTML5/JavaScript, na kterém běží původní kód hry Spacewar!, nejstarší známé digitální videohry. K hraní je možné použít klávesnici, ale podporovány jsou i gamepady nebo joysticky. Pokud je použijete, dosáhnete autentičtějšího zážitku, hra se původně hrála pomocí vlastních ovládacích boxů.
articles.title: Zahrajte si první počítačovou hru Spacewar! v emulátoru DEC PDP-1 v prohlížeči

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Zástupci společnosti Google uvedli, že v loňském roce zablokovali 2,28 milionu škodlivých aplikací, které měly být nahrány do Obchodu Play. V roce 2023 jsme zabránili zveřejnění 2,28 milionu aplikací porušujících zásady v Google Play, a to částečně díky investicím do nových a vylepšených bezpečnostních funkcí, aktualizacím zásad a pokročilému strojovému učení a procesům kontroly aplikací, uvedli Steve Kafka, Khawaja Shams a Mohet Saxena ze společnosti Google.
articles.title: Google v roce 2023 zabránil 2,28 milionu škodlivých aplikací v přístupu do Obchodu Play

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Vývojáři hudebního přehrávače Amarok oznámili vydání verze 3.0 s kódovým označením Castaway. Jedná se o první stabilní verzi využívající Qt 5 a KDE Frameworks 5 a první stabilní vydání od finální verze 2.9.0 založené na Qt 4 v roce 2018.
articles.title: Vyšel Amarok 3.0 Castaway postavený na Qt 5

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: V GNOME 46, které je například v čerstvě vydaném Ubuntu 24.04 LTS, se objevila možnost zapnout VRR (variable refresh rate), což by mělo pomoci snížit spotřebu.
articles.title: V GNOME 46 zatím nezapínejte VRR (variable refresh rate)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Při rezervaci online si software letecké společnosti American Airlines si spletl 100letou paní Patricii a dítě. Patricie měla správně vyplněný ročník narozeni 1922, ale software uložil častější 2022.
articles.title: Software letecké společnosti American Airlines si spletl 100letou paní a dítě

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Po vydání Ubuntu 24.04 LTS bylo zveřejněno kódové označení pro následující Ubuntu 24.10, které má vyjít letos v říjnu. Bude se jmenovat Oracular Oriole čili něco jako prorocká žluva.
articles.title: Ubuntu 24.10 bude Oracular Oriole - prorocká žluva

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Linuxových systémů přibývá, každý den se spouštějí nové servery a někdo se o ně musí starat. To znamená spoustu různých dovedností specifických právě pro linuxové prostředí. Jak to zprovoznit, kudy bezpečně dovnitř, co tam najdeme, jak se o to postaráme a jak to nastavíme nebo rozšíříme.
articles.title: Naučte se používat Linux správně a bezpečně (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Někteří uživatelé prohlížeče Google Chrome hlásí problémy s připojením k webovým serverům poté, co byl minulý týden vydán Chrome 124 s novým kvantově odolným zapouzdřovacím mechanismem X25519Kyber768, který je ve výchozím nastavení povolen u všech uživatelů. Google začal s novým algoritmem experimentovat už v loni srpnu a teď jej nejnovější aktualizace zapnula.
articles.title: Postkvantová kryptografie v Chrome rozbíjí špatné implementace TLS v serverech

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Robert McQueen, prezident Nadace GNOME, na svém blogu popsal současné finanční problémy organizace. Nadace už více než tři roky hospodaří s deficitem a každoročně tak utratí víc, než kolik získá. Daří se to díky rezervám vytvořených z významných darů získaných před čtyřmi až pěti lety lety.
articles.title: Nadace GNOME má finanční potíže a pracuje na nové strategii

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Velké jazykové modely (LLM) s malým počtem parametrů jsou vhodné jako umělá inteligence přímo v mobilním telefonu, bez nutnosti komunikovat se serverem. Společnost Apple představila OpenELM (Open-source Efficient Language Models). Je zde sice open-source, ale licence Apple Sample Code nejde úplně označit jako open-source licence. Nicméně zdrojové kódy jsou k dispozici.
articles.title: Apple představil malé jazykové modely, vhodné do telefonu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Prohlížeče Firefox a Safari blokují sledující cookies třetích stran již od roku 2020. Google tento krok v majoritním Chrome neustále odkládá. Loni přišel s kontroverzní náhradou se zvláštním názvem Privacy Sandbox. Tenkrát se hovořilo o vypnutí cookies třetích stran v Chrome ve druhé polovině roku 2024.
articles.title: Kdy už bude Chrome blokovat cookies třetích stran? Letos to nebude

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Křivánek)
articles.description: Dnes vyšlo Pharo 12, objektově orientovaný programovací jazyk a vývojové prostředí s řadou pokročilých vlastností. Krom tradiční nadílky oprav a vylepšení přináší nový systém správy ladících bodů, nový způsob definice tříd či prostor pro objekty, které nemusí procházet garbage collector.
articles.title: Pharo 12 s vylepšenou správou ladících bodů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Včera vyšlo Ubuntu 24.04 LTS Noble Numbat. Server Phoronix testoval výkon 24.04, 23.10 a 22.04.4 na procesorech Intel Core i9 14900K a AMD Ryzen 9 7950X.
articles.title: Ubuntu 24.04 LTS je v průměru o 5 % rychlejší než 22.04 LTS

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Apache je jeden z nejrozšířenějších a nejpoužívanějších webových server současnosti, na školení Web server Apache se ho naučíme instalovat, spravovat a ladit pro co nejhladší běh našich služeb. Vše si vyzkoušíte prakticky na ostrém serveru, na kterém budete mít možnost provozovat skutečný web a ovlivňovat jeho nastavení.
articles.title: Naučte se používat web server Apache (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Před deseti lety Microsoft uvolnil zdrojové kódy systémů MS-DOS 1.25 a 2.0 pro Muzeum počítačové historie a později je znovu zveřejnil na GitHubu pro referenční účely. Tento kód zaujímá významné místo v historii a je fascinujícím čtením o operačním systému, který byl před téměř 45 lety napsán výhradně v kódu assembleru 8086, vysvětluje Microsoft.
articles.title: Zdrojové kódy systému MS-DOS 4.0 zveřejněny pod licencí MIT

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Vyšlo očekávané Ubuntu 24.04 LTS Noble Numbat, které bude mít standardní podporu do června roku 2029. Stávajícím uživatelům předchozí LTS verze bude aktualizace nabídnuta až s prvním opravným vydáním 24.04.1 LTS, které je plánováno na 15. srpna. Uživatelé verze 23.10 s krátkou podporou budou vyzváni k aktualizaci okamžitě.
articles.title: Vyšlo Ubuntu 24.04 LTS Noble Numbat s GNOME 46

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Grafické uživatelské rozhraní projektu OpenRazer zajišťující na Linuxu ovládací GUI všem užiatelům zařízení a periferií značky Razer, pomalu přechází na Qt5. Vedle Polychromatic 0.8.4 nyní vyšla i verze 0.9, která nově využívá pro svůj běh knihovnu PyQt6 a tudíž Qt6.
articles.title: Polychromatic, GUI projektu OpenRazer, přechází na Qt6

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Přehled dubnových vydání Jaderných novin: stav vydání jádra, citáty týdne a seznam článků týkajících se jádra.
articles.title: Jaderné noviny – přehled za duben 2024

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Je tady květen a ti, kdo se chystají sestavit si novou mašinu budou mít příležitost obětovat větší částku za hardwarové komponenty, nebo přidat si za nějaké další licence, které hned nenašli na Goodoffer24.com, zde mají velké slevy nabízené v porovnání s oficiálními ceníky.

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Audit kybernetické bezpečnosti: výchozí stav pro splnění požadavků NIS2. Nový typ supravodičů by měl umožnit topologické kvantové počítače. GenAI má na evropském trhu umělé inteligence zatím jen velmi malý podíl. Dell představuje souborové úložiště Dell APEX pro Microsoft Azure. Nový ransomware typu „junk gun“ narušuje fungování ransomwaru jako služby.

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Nová metoda zlepší bezpečnost a spolehlivost autonomního řízení. Kolik energie se skrývá ve vakuu? Webbův dalekohled znovu ukázal podivně vyspělý obraz raného vesmíru.

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Fotonické čipy ze stolní tiskárny. Udržitelná datacentra? Projekt Schneider Electric a Digital Realty představuje nadějný příslib. Pouze 3 % firem je odolných proti současným kyberbezpečnostním hrozbám. Jak vypadá kybernetický útok. 90 % útoků v roce 2023 zneužívalo protokol RDP.

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Nikdo asi nebude diskutovat, že Windows a Office od Microsoftu je nákladný software, bez ohledu na to, kdo jste. Dokud si ale neuvědomíte kde koupit OEM licence, na které jsou mnohem větší slevy než je jinak obvyklé. articles.description: Služba Dropbox Sign (původně HelloSign) pro elektronické podepisování smluv byla hacknuta.

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová major verze 8.0 textového editoru GNU nano (Wikipedie). Podrobný přehled novinek a oprav v oznámení v diskusním listu info-nano nebo v souboru ChangeLog na Savannah. Volbou --modernbindings (-/) lze povolit "moderní" klávesové zkratky: ^C kopírování, ^V vložení, ^Z vrácení zpět, … Tato volba je aktivována také pokud binárka s nano nebo link na ni začíná písmenem "e".

articles.description: With the recently released Ubuntu 24.04 LTS I've shown various benchmarks how it can deliver nice performance gains over both Ubuntu 23.10 and the existing Ubuntu 22.04 LTS on different platforms. Those benchmarks have tended to focus on the latest-generation processors/platforms given that's where the excitement is these days. But for those on older platforms like AMD 3rd Gen EPYC "Milan" servers, here are some benchmarks looking at the performance impact of an Ubuntu 24.04 LTS upgrade...

articles.description: Intel motherboard manufacturers have begun rolling out BIOS updates containing an "Intel Baseline Profile" option to apply stock power limits to modern Intel processors. This is being driven by instability claims for 13th Gen and 14th Gen Intel Core processors having stability issues for some Windows gamers that is being attributed to multi-core enhancement (MCE) and other power options commonly set on enthusiast desktop motherboards. As the first of several ongoing tests I'm working on at Phoronix, here are some preliminary findings for using the Intel Baseline Profile option on an ASUS motherboard with the Core i9 14900K under Ubuntu Linux.
articles.title: Intel Baseline Profile Yields Odd Power/Performance On Linux

articles.author: Michael Beckwith
articles.description:
While Marvel vs. Capcom: Infinite was a solid fighting game, it was unfortunately overshadow by its flaws, among them being its less than handsome graphics. It's been nearly seven years since its launch, and it's been decided the game needs a fresh coat of paint courtesy of an impressive looking mod.


This mod comes courtesy of one WistfulHopes, and was commissioned by streamer and fighting game content creator Maximillian Christensen, better known as Maximilian Dood. According to Christensen, the mod is still "in the early stages, with only a couple days of tinkering," but it's frankly already a major glow-up for the game. You can see some screenshots of the mod on WistfulHopes' Twitter account, as well as a brief gameplay clip demonstrating how the mod looks in motion.




The goal seem…
articles.title: Marvel vs. Capcom: Infinite mod gives the game a much needed cel-shaded makeover

articles.author: Matt Porter
articles.description:
Another major Warzone patch means another overpowered weapon, with players on Rebirth Island now torturing their enemies with an Akimbo Lockwood MK2 loadout that is reminiscent of the Model 1887s from 2009's Modern Warfare 2. 


After the destruction of the Rennti Conversion Kit class finally came to an end, CoD players were hoping it would be a while before one gun was so dominant in the meta. Unfortunately, that dream was shortlived, as Season 3 Reloaded introduced the JAK Wardens Conversion Kit for the Lockwood MK2. 


At the moment, this weapon is a two-shot kill against enemies, even if they are plated up. This makes it incredibly powerful at close range, and I've already found myself dying to it on Rebirth Island. If you want to try it for yourself, here's how to make Warzone's Model…
articles.title: How to build Warzone’s overpowered Model 1887 Akimbo Lockwood MK2 loadout

articles.author: Michael Beckwith
articles.description:
Despite The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom being nearly a year old, imaginative fans are still using its Zonai devices and Ultrahand mechanic to craft incredible creations. For instance, someone recently managed to put together a recreation of the intro to the original 80s Transformers cartoon.


As spotted by Game Rant, the 33 second clip was shared to the Hyrule Engineering subreddit, where Tears of the Kingdom players post videos and screenshots of any in-game builds they're proud of, or ask for general building advice. This clip is simply an impressive feat of engineering, with it featuring 34 different builds according to creator Reddit user ReelDeadOne. Aside from making stand-ins for the Autobots and Decepticons, they built their vehicle forms, their weapons, and even the Tra…
articles.title: Original Transformers intro gets stunning shot-for-shot remake in Tears of the Kingdom

articles.author: Matt Porter
articles.description:
Arrowhead Studios dropped a new hotfix for Helldivers 2 on May 2, with patch 01.000.301 focusing on addressing the annoying crashing issues that have been kicking players out of games. 


Following on from April 29's 01.000.300 update, Arrowhead haven't made any weapon balancing changes with this hotfix, instead focusing on the errors and glitches that have stopped players from enjoying the game. 


Specifically, the developer has been looking at crashing bugs, deploying a fix for a crash that would happen after the post-mission end screen, and another crash that could happen if you destroyed an Automaton tank. I personally encountered the first crash a few times, so I'm delighted to see it fixed. Now I won't have to restart the game every time I finish a mission, which was getting tedious…
articles.title: Helldivers 2 hotfix patch 01.000.301 fixes frustrating crashing issues

articles.author: Michael Beckwith
articles.description:
Respawn has shared official details for season 21 of Apex Legends, including its subtitle: Upheaval. Aside from introducing fans to the newest playable Legend—Alter—Respawn's also confirmed that it's bringing back the game's short-lived Solos mode.


In case you missed out on it the first time, Solos is fundamentally the same as Apex Legends' main battle royale mode, except players aren't divided into teams, turning matches into free-for-alls. Respawn's website currently hasn't gone into any further detail on the mode's inclusion, but it has been rumored that Solos will be a permanent addition this time around. Originally, Solos was only available for two weeks in August 2019. After nearly five years, I'm sure some players have been hankering for it again. If it does stick around, it could…
articles.title: Apex Legends is bringing back Solos alongside twisted trickster Alter

articles.author: Matt Porter
articles.description:
Leakers trawling through the files of Modern Warfare Season 3 Reloaded have discovered an upcoming weapon blueprint linked to Call of Duty 2024, but while some players are convinced it confirms Black Ops 6 as the title, I'm not so sure that's the case. 


After every major CoD patch, dataminers spend time searching through the files included in the update to see what is coming to the game in the future. Usually, this process unveils new maps, modes, or weapons, and that was the case with Season 3 Reloaded. 


As discovered by realityuk_, a new Pistol linked to 2024's Call of Duty release is set to be added to the game, with the name "Sally" written on it, and six tally marks. This has immediately set tongues wagging, with plenty of fans claiming the tally marks are confirmation that Black Ops 6 will be released later this year. 




For those hyped by this prospect, I'm here to pour some cold water on the flames of your excitement. Look at that gun again, and tell me if you think it looks familiar. It should do, because it's the same pistol featured on the cover of 2010's Call of Duty: Black Ops, complete with the same tally marks and Sally scratching. 


In my opinion, the inclusion of this pistol is to hype up the new Treyarch-developed game, but this pistol doesn't tell us anything about a possible name. 


It's the exact same pistol. Image via Activision


 As for what the next CoD could be called, the prevailing theory right now is Black Ops Gulf War, although that hasn't been confirmed just yet. We'll likely learn more during the Call of Duty Direct that's set to take place on Sunday, June 9. 

The post Black Ops 6 confirmed!? MW3 leak has players convinced but I’m not so sure appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Black Ops 6 confirmed!? MW3 leak has players convinced but I’m not so sure

articles.author: Steven Mills
articles.description:
The second task you can take on for the Vendor Gunny in Gray Zone Warfare is Leave No Man Behind. This task requires you to find a specific fallen soldier and mark his body for his extraction. Here is how you can complete the Leave No Man Behind task in Gray Zone Warfare and where you can find the fallen soldier's body.





Where to find and mark the location of the body


You can find and mark the location of the body required for the Leave No Man Behind task outside behind a specific building in each of the three starter towns. Make sure you have a Tracker on you for this task. If you do not have one, you can purchase one from Gunny at base camp for $50. The location is in the back area of a walled-in yard of a beige-colored building. You'll immediately notice the location of the body by the blood-red splatter on the beige wall, and the body you are looking for is under it. Here is the exact location and coordinates of the body for each faction:



Mithras Security Systems - 170, 119 in the western part of Nam Thaven


Crimson Shield International - 143, 163 in the eastern part of Kiu Vongsa


Lamang Recovery Initiative - 202, 161 in the southern part of Pha Lang



How to complete Leave No Man Behind


As long as you have a GPS Tracker on you which can be acquired for $50 from Gunny, you will have the option to place the Tracker on the fallen soldier's body. Doing so will update both the Mark the location of the body and Locate the body objectives for the Leave No Man Behind task, so it is time to head to an LZ and extract to base camp.


Once you're back at the base camp, open the Vendors tab and go to Gunny. From here, click the yellow Complete button to finish the Leave No Man Behind task, earning the following helpful rewards:



1x AMP12 Backpack with 20 slots


$3,400


400 Experience


100 Reputation with Gunny




The post How to complete Leave No Man Behind in Gray Zone Warfare appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to complete Leave No Man Behind in Gray Zone Warfare

articles.author: Steven Mills
articles.description:
Every time you turn in a task in Gray Zone Warfare, you receive numerous rewards. Typically you're rewarded with some items, cash, experience, and reputation with the Vendor who gave you the task. However, some users have noticed they aren't receiving the physical task rewards such as items and cash. Here's how to fix the missing task rewards in Gray Zone Warfare and get the items and cash you are missing for completing tasks.





How to get your rewards for completing tasks


In order to fix your missing task rewards in Gray Zone Warfare and get the items and cash you are missing, you need to collect the rewards from the messenger. Every time you complete a task that includes a physical item as a reward, be it some sort of loot, gear, or cash, you should get a notification in the bottom right that you received a message from that Vendor.


The message you receive is actually how you collect your missing rewards. Hit Tab to open up the UI when you are base camp, then look for the message icon in the top right, as indicated by the red arrow in the above screenshot. This opens up your messenger app, and now you want to click on the window of whichever Vendor you completed the task for. Then, in the message log on the right, you should see a yellow button where you can collect the items and cash that have been sent to you from the vendor.


Non-physical rewards such as experience and reputation are automatically given to you when you complete the task and do not need to be collected. So every time you complete the task, this is all you have to do to get your rewards:



Complete the task by clicking the complete button on the proper Vendor tab.


Open the messenger app by clicking the message icon in the top right of the UI.


Click on the Vendor who gave you the task.


Click on the collect button to receive the task rewards.


The post How to fix missing task rewards in Gray Zone Warfare appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to fix missing task rewards in Gray Zone Warfare

articles.author: Ryan Lemay
articles.description:
Modern Warfare 3 Season 3 Reloaded adds an iconic Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare AR back into the fold. Here is everything you need to know about the BAL-27 and its best class setup for multiplayer. 


It won't take long for players to notice that the BAL-27 is not your traditional AR. The weapon has a unique damage profile because the first four shots have a slower fire rate than the rest of the magazine. As a result, the weapon easily mows down enemies, but there is a slight delay in reaching that maximum damage value. 


Without any statistics to use, it's hard to pinpoint how exactly the BAL-27 will stack up against other options during Season 3 Reloaded. But after getting some hands-on experience with the AR in a few multiplayer matches, the BAL-27 has potential and could very well be one of the best weapons to use. We set out to create a perfectly balanced loadout that excels in every category. 


 Best BAL-27 loadout in MW3 multiplayer






Muzzle: Purifier Muzzle Break


Barrel: Crown-H3 Barrel 


Underbarrel: DR-6 Handstop 


Stock: Clarent Light Stock


Rear Grip: Channel-M Grip



While using an AR, Tac-Stance, and hip-fire are irrelevant because those attributes are more important when using an SMG in close-range gunfights. So, for this BAl-27 loadout, we sacrificed both to improve statistics more suited for a medium-and-long-range dedicated weapon. Lets start with the Purifier Muzzle Break improves horizontal recoil and firing aim stability at the cost of bullet velocity and range. So to counteract that loss, the Crown-H3 Barrel improves Bullet Velocity and Range. 


Next, the DR-6 Handstop and Channel-M Grip both forego hip-fire and Tac-Stance spread to greatly improve ADS and aim walking speed, recoil, and gunk kick. Finally, the Clarent Light Stock addresses ADS Walking, crouching, and general movement speeds. This set of attachments strikes the perfect chord between mobility and recoil control.

The post Best BAL-27 loadout and class setup in Modern Warfare 3 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Best BAL-27 loadout and class setup in Modern Warfare 3

In Disney Dreamlight Valley, you'll encounter three trials with mini puzzles as you explore Eternity Isle's ancient ruins. During the "A Bit of Help From Your Friends" quest, EVE's trial requires you to power an ancient console, while Rapunzel tests your musical ability by arranging notes on a stone wall. 


Disney Dreamlight Valley music note arrangement puzzle solution


You'll first find the solution to Rapunzel's music note arrangement puzzle on the floor in the East Chamber. After clearing out boulders and crystals, you'll uncover a small pressure plate and a note, revealing the placement of each musical note. Once you find this hint, interact with the three pillars in the room's center to move each note up along the wall, aligning them with the lines you find in the note.


Screenshot by Destructoid


Interacting with a pillar once raises a music note by half a line. If you wish to use the note hint to figure out the puzzle on your own, now's your chance. You can find the note again by heading into your Eternity Isles memories menu and selecting the note under the Dreamlight Valley section. Otherwise, you'll find the exact music note arrangement below.


Screenshot by Destructoid


The leftmost note lays the lowest and needs only a couple of pillar activations, while the others require multiple. Once you use the pillars to place the notes on each line, stand on the plate you uncovered earlier to activate the puzzle's power and hear a brief singing session from Rapunzel. Doing this lets you progress through the "A Bit of Help From Your Friends" quest, leading to you activating one last pressure plate and unlocking the Ancient ruin's trap door. 

The post How to find the right arrangement of music notes in Disney Dreamlight Valley appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to find the right arrangement of music notes in Disney Dreamlight Valley

articles.author: Ryan Lemay
articles.description:
Activision has already introduced several big-name crossovers during Modern Warfare 3's life cycle, but leaks point to a massive event coming in Season 4. 


Season 3 Reloaded just started, but players are already looking forward to what's next. CoD leaker WarfareForum discovered files mentioning Fallout, Gundam, and The Crow crossovers in a data mine. This shouldn't come as too much of a surprise as Amazon Prime's Fallout show sparked a resurgence in popularity for the storied franchise. Several Fallout titles hit new concurrent player peaks, and the show was quickly renewed for a second season after shattering expectations. 


Image via Amazon Prime


Activision has already established a trend of springboarding off the success of television shows. During Season 3, Activision added Rick Grimes and Michonne from The Walking Dead, coinciding with the launch of a new spinoff show. Before that, during Season 1, the devs reintroduced operator skins for Homelander, Starlight, and Black Noir from Amazon Prime's The Boys a few months before the upcoming new season this summer. 


Using these previous crossovers as evidence, the Fallout show has plenty of potential candidates for operator skins. The three protagonists, Lucy, Cooper Howard, and Maximus, would all fit perfectly into the Modern Warfare 3 universe. An operator bundle usually costs around $20, including weapon blueprints, finishing moves, and other cosmetic items. Based on the Season 3 battle pass, we expect Season 4 to start on Wednesday, May 29. 

The post Fallout crossover rumored for MW3 and Warzone Season 4 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Fallout crossover rumored for MW3 and Warzone Season 4

articles.author: Ryan Lemay
articles.description:
Game-breaking glitches have marred Season 3 Reloaded's launch day in Modern Warfare 3 and Warzone. One of the issues makes it impossible to reload weapons, but thankfully there is a simple temporary workaround. 


The Activision support team launched an investigation into an issue causing auto-tac sprinting to prevent reloading a weapon. Raven Software presented players with a temporary fix while attempting to permanently address the matter. Let's jump right into what's required. 


How to fix the auto tac-sprint reload glitch in MW3 and Warzone


Image via Activision 


Here is a step-by-step guide on how to fix the auto-tac sprint reload glitch. 



Launch MW3


Go into the Settings tab, which is located in the top-hand corner of your screen


Select Controller 


Scroll over to Gameplay 


Under Automatic Sprint, select Off from the drop-down menu 



With this setting selected, sprinting is activated manually with the sprint button. Getting used to playing without sprinting automatically will take some getting used to, but it's much better than not being able to reload at all. Raven Software did not provide a time-line for when this issue will be addressed. 


Season 3 Reloaded also caused Dev Error 5433 to rear its ugly head and created issues for PlayStation users trying to login. If this is still a problem for you, make sure to check out our guide on how the devs recommend fixing the error code, while a permanent solution gets worked on. 

The post How to fix the auto tac-sprint reload glitch in MW3 and Warzone appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to fix the auto tac-sprint reload glitch in MW3 and Warzone

articles.description:
The late legend Kobe Bryant has served as the cover star for NBA 2K24 and, for many, a strong incentive to reach the top Collector Level in the game's MyTeam mode. As the NBA playoffs' first round wraps up, many fans are more disappointed than excited with the most recent NBA 2K title, as developer Visual Concepts has pulled back on a promise made prior to launch. 
In the lead-up to the game's release date, the NBA 2K24 developer Visual Concepts released a blog post running down the features of its card-collection mode, MyTeam. In that blog post, the developer laid out several features and rewards for the then-upcoming title. It took special care to devote a section to an upcoming Collector Level reward, Kobe Bryant. 
In that post, the developer highlights just how crucial Collector Level …

articles.description:
The Batman: Arkham series redefined the superhero genre and changed the course of action games in the decade following Arkham Asylum's release. While four mainline entries – Asylum, City, Origins, and Knight – delivered similar gameplay, a smaller spin-off game, 2016's Batman: Arkham VR, let players step into the shoes of the Caped Crusader using their PlayStation VR, Oculus Rift, or HTC Vive headset. Batman: Arkham VR felt more like a tech demo than a fully fleshed-out game, but its relatively high sales showed that the appetite was there. Today, Oculus Studios announced another VR title set in the Batman: Arkham universe titled Batman: Arkham Shadow.
Though Rocksteady Studios, the developer of Asylum, City, and Knight, was behind Batman: Arkham VR, the developer that most recently releas…
articles.title: Batman: Arkham Shadow Announced For Meta Quest 3 This Year

articles.author: Wesley LeBlanc
articles.description:
Zynga has released a new trailer for its upcoming competitive multiplayer game, Star Wars: Hunters, revealing a June 4 release date alongside a new cinematic look at some of the characters. Star Wars: Hunters will hit Switch and iOS and Android devices on that day, giving players the chance to compete with others in iconic locations like the forest moon of Endor, the icy planet of Hoth, and elsewhere while controlling Hunters like J-3DI, a droid who thinks he's a Jedi, Utooni which is two Jawas stacked on top of each other in a trench coat, and more. 
Zynga says each Hunter boasts their own unique set of abilities to aid them in the Arena, which is the marquee attraction of the new planet of Vespaara. "Star Wars: Hunters features a number of game modes for players to test their mettle, such as Squad Brawl, in which opposing teams will battle to rack up the most eliminations, and Trophy Chase, where competing teams will vie for control of the elusive droid TR-F33," a press release reads. 
Check out the action in the new Star Wars: Hunters trailer below: 


"We are beyond excited to welcome fans across the globe to Vespaara," Zynga vice president Sam Cooper writes in a press release. "We can't wait for gamers to meet our Hunters and hop into the Arena. There are so many fun twists and winks to recognizable, beloved Star Wars settings, creatures, and themes within our game that we also are eager to see players worldwide get the chance to discover." 
Star Wars: Hunters will be available worldwide on Switch, iOS, and Android devices. It will be free, and on Switch, it does not require a Nintendo Switch Online membership to download and play.
For more, watch the Star Wars: Hunters reveal trailer, and then check out some gameplay from it here. 
Are you going to check out Star Wars: Hunters in June? Let us know in the comments below!
articles.title: Star Wars: Hunters Gets June Release Date For Switch In New Trailer

articles.author: Wesley LeBlanc
articles.description:
Square Enix, the company behind last year's Final Fantasy XVI and this year's Final Fantasy VII Rebirth, has seemingly canceled some in-development games, taking on some big losses as a result. As for why, the company is aiming to be more selective about its projects moving forward. 
This news comes from a release related to Square Enix's holdings, which explains the company is incurring losses of 22.1 billion Yen, or roughly $140 million, on its financial books for the fiscal year that ended in March. 


"At the meeting convened on March 27, 2024, the Board of Directors of Square Enix Holdings voted, in light of the myriad changes underway in the environment surrounding its group, to revise the group's approach to the development of high-definition (HD) games with the intention of being more selective and focused in the allocation of development resources," the release reads. "As a result of a close examination, the company expects to recognize approximately 22.1 billion Yen in content abandonment losses on its books for the fiscal year ended March 2024." 
While potentially canceled games might sound doom and gloom, it sounds more like Square Enix is sharpening its developmental focus to ensure that the games it releases are hits or, at the very least, financially successful for the company. Nonetheless, it sounds like roughly $140 million of games in development have been canceled and it's unlikely we'll ever find out what they were. 
This release comes after a big splash from Final Fantasy VII Rebirth, which Square Enix released in February. Elsehwere in 2024, Square Enix is releasing Final Fantasy XIV: Dawntrail, the new expansion for the MMO that will kick off a new saga for the long-running game, in July. 
What's your take on this news? Let us know in the comments below!
articles.title: Square Enix Has Seemingly Canceled Some Games In An Effort To Be 'More Selective And Focused'

articles.author: Wesley LeBlanc
articles.description:
Housemarque is celebrating the three-year anniversary of its hit shooter roguelike Returnal by teaming up with Dark Horse Comics for a graphic novel, artbook, and a new animated adaptation you can watch right now. This news follows yesterday's tease from both Housemarque and later Dark Horse Comics about Returnal, sending fans into an understandable frenzy about what the teams had in store for players. 
"Another year, another cycle," a post on X (formerly Twitter) from Housemarque reads. "The Third time around, extra loot is exposed with Dark Horse flair." 
Here's what that flair brings to the Returnal universe: 
Returnal: Fallen Asteria Graphic Novel
Returnal Artbook
Fallen Asteria Animated Adaptation
Now, even with PlayStation dipping its toes into cross-media production with Amazon's God of War series and Netflix's Horizon adaptation, this Returnal adaptation isn't the same. Instead, it's an "animated version of the first issue of the upcoming graphic novel, Returnal: Fallen Asteria." Check it out for yourself below: 


Hosuemarque says the 88-page graphic novel will arrive in paperback on bookstore shelves starting October 22, 2024, and it will hit comic book shops the next day. 
It's unclear if the animated adaptation above is the animated adaptation today's announcement is referring to or, if it's just the first part of it, since it only adapts the first issue of the graphic novel. 
Here's a look at the Returnal: Fallen Asteria issues coming this October: 
There's no word on when the Returnal artbook will arrive, but presumably it's this year. 
For more about the game, read Game Informer's Returnal review, and then check out this story about the PC specs required to play Returnal on a desktop or laptop. After that, read about Returnal's Ascension update, which added co-op gameplay and a new challenge tower to the game. 
Returnal hit PlayStation 5 on April 30, 2021. It launched on PC on February 15, 2023. 
Are you excited about today's Returnal news? Let us know in the comments below!
articles.title: Housemarque Celebrates Returnal's 3-Year Anniversary With Fallen Asteria Animated Adaptation, Graphic Novel, And More

articles.author: Wesley LeBlanc
articles.description:
Starfield's first expansion, Shattered Space, is set to arrive this fall, according to director Todd Howard. Plus, a new update for Starfield is coming later this week that will make changes to ship-building mechanics and more. 
Howard revealed this and more about Starfield in a new interview with Kinda Funny, which is where the Bethesda executive producer also discussed Amazon's Fallout TV show and the Fallout series in general, as reported by XboxEra. As for what to expect of Shattered Space, Howard didn't say much. However, we already know it will bring new story content, locations, gear, and more to Starfield. 


As noted by XboxEra, Shattered Space will be free for all Starfield Deluxe Edition owners. 
As for the update coming to Starfield later this week, Howard says it will focus on the ship-building. This lines up with what the Starfield team shared last year in its 2024 plans for the game. Here's what it said at the time: "For those who love ship building, we'll also be expanding on ship customization with ship decorations, new ship building options, and more."
Other updates scheduled for 2024 include new ways to travel, city maps, mod support, accessibility and additional difficulty options, and more. 
For more about the game, read Game Informer's Starfield review, and then read about how Starfield is surprisingly great as a remote-play game. After that, check out this story about how Starfield is more like a sci-fi theme park than an open world adventure. 
[Source: Kinda Funny via XboxEra]
What do you hope to see in the Shattered Space expansion? Let us know in the comments below!
articles.title: Starfield's First Expansion, Shattered Space, To Release This Fall

articles.description:
The Jackbox Party Packs have always allowed for adult-themed responses, but it was never solicited or directly encouraged by the games themselves. For those who have wanted a more mature experience, Jackbox Games is finally granting you your wish, as it has announced Jackbox Naughty Pack, a new release of three games that promises spicy prompts and dirty fun later this year.
We don't know what kinds of games will be included, but Jackbox Games teases "spicy surprises and maybe even some familiar faces." Does that tease a new, mature-themed You Don't Know Jack? Will we get dirtier iterations on some classic Jackbox titles? Or will these be all new games that just so happen to include some favorite characters from past games? Unfortunately, for now, Jackbox Games is being tight-lipped with the contents of Jackbox Naughty Pack.
However, the studio did release a teaser trailer, which you can view right here. Jackbox Naughty Pack will arrive sometime this year, and Jackbox Games promises more details this summer.
Are you excited for a spicier take on Jackbox Party Pack? Do you and the people you play Jackbox games with typically go mature-themed with your answers, or are you more of a family-friendly Jackbox gamer? Let us know what you hope from Jackbox Naughty Pack in the comments below!

articles.description:
Housemarque, the developer of titles such as Returnal and Resogun, has teased some kind of announcement for tomorrow. 
In a post on X, the developer simply posted a graphic of what appears to be a fractured reflection of a woman’s eyes with the word “Tomorrow.”
pic.twitter.com/F4R6TYFyZ1
April 29, 2024
Less than two hours later, Housemarque shared a brief video clip of the same image but in animated form.
pic.twitter.com/uAkzYOCjjn
April 29, 2024
While the kneejerk reaction is to assume this announcement is related to Returnal, be it a sequel or something else, that seems unlikely. In 2022, Housemarque stated it was developing a new IP for its next title. However, that wouldn't necessarily rule out the possibility of more Returnal DLC, if nothing else. Much has changed for Housemarque since Returnal launched in April 2021, such as being acquired by Sony just a couple of months later. Returnal launched on PC in February 2023 and has been updated with additional content and features such as co-op. 
Thankfully, we don’t have to wait long to learn what Housemarque has up its sleeve next. In the meantime, be sure to check out our review of Returnal here.
